PREFACE The Proprietors trust that this — the Seventeenth — Edition of the Directory of Scotland may be found at least equal in accuracy to previous ones. Under each County the Parishes, Towns and principal Villages have been arranged in strict Alphabetical order, with a view to facility of reference, and the names of the Magistrates, the Members of the County Councils, the County Officers, &c, have been given. The Cities of Edinburgh and Glasgow, with a Street Directory in each case, are given separately. In addition to the lists of names given in the " Private Residents " and " Trades and Professional " sections .there is also a list of the " Principal Seats " in Scotland. This list gives the names of the occupiers, together with references to the pages in the body of the book on which particulars of the various mansions will be found. Prefixed to the Book is a complete Index to the whole of the places given therein. April, 1928. SCOT.
